title: Java Mathlog1p()Method

metadata.description: Learn about Java Mathlog1p()Method with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Return the natural logarithm of 1 + x for different values of x:
System.out.println(Math.log1p(6));
System.out.println(Math.log1p(Math.E));
System.out.println(Math.log1p(2));
System.out.println(Math.log1p(1));
System.out.println(Math.log1p(0));
System.out.println(Math.log1p(-1));

Definition and Usage
The
log1p()
method returns the natural logarithm of 1 + x for any number x.
The natural logarithm is the logarithm with base
e
. The value of
e
is approximately 2.718282 and it is available as the constant
Math.E
in Java.
Syntax
public static double log1p(double
number
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
number
Required. A value greater than or equal to -1. If the value is less than -1 the method returns NaN (Not a Number).
Technical Details
Returns:
A
double
value representing the natural logarithm of 1 + x for a number x.
Java version:
1.5+

★
+1

practice_exercises.title: Implement a Function
practice_exercises.description: Create a function that demonstrates the concepts from this tutorial.

related_topics.title: Java Common Pitfalls and How to Avoid Them

quiz.question: What is The natural logarithm?
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of The natural logarithm is 'the logarithm with base
e'.

quiz.question:
What is The value of
e?
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of The value of
e is 'approximately 2'.

summary: This tutorial covers Java Mathlog1p()Method concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Java Mathlog1p()Method effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Java Mathlog1p()Method and how to apply it in your projects.
